author: {'steamid': '76561199443309380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1710630299}
review:
Se trata en el que estas en una cueva submarina en el cual debes que controlar todo la cueva a base de peces con forma de algo así parecido a un espermatozoide (no se porque tiene ese diseño parecido o igual), en el que se genera en un circulo al que debes que llevarlo a otros círculos donde respawnean también y en otro como puede ser espermatozoides que luchan y defienden a su especie de los espermatozoides enemigos y conquistarles su zona. Pero es  muy entretenido.
También es cierto que tiene varios mapas al cual jugar y también jugar contra un bot o contra otros jugadores (todavía sigo sin entender un poco el tema de jugar con jugadores).

Cosas positivas.

- Estilo gráfico bonito.
- Controles fáciles de entender.
- Aún teniendo el tutorial puesto lo entiendes a la primera yendo a tu bola.
- Entretenido al jugarlo.
- Variedad de mapas.

Cosas negativas.

- Ninguna.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021551803', 'num_games_owned': 5281, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1706025786}
review:
[h1]Boid[/h1]
[i]Mediocre-time strategy[/i]

[b]Boid[/b], a real-time strategy game, falls short of expectations with its lacklustre execution and uninspired gameplay. While it attempts to bring innovation to the genre, it ultimately fails to deliver a compelling and engaging experience.

One of the major drawbacks of [b]Boid[/b] is its underwhelming graphics. The visuals lack the polish and detail that players have come to expect from modern strategy games. The unit designs are generic, and the environments lack the depth and vibrancy that could have added to the overall immersion.

The gameplay mechanics, touted as a unique selling point, fail to make a lasting impression. The concept of controlling swarms of units is interesting on paper, but in practice, it often feels clunky and imprecise. The controls lack the responsiveness needed for smooth and intuitive gameplay, leading to frustrating moments when trying to coordinate your units effectively.

Furthermore, the lack of a compelling storyline or engaging campaign mode leaves much to be desired. The lacklustre narrative makes it difficult for players to stay invested in the game beyond the initial stages. The campaign missions themselves feel repetitive, with little variation in objectives or challenges.

[b]Boid[/b] also suffers from a lack of community support and updates. The game seems to have been abandoned by its developers, with minimal patches or content additions post-launch. This neglect leaves players with a sense of disappointment, especially considering the potential that could have been unlocked with continuous support.

While [b]Boid[/b] may appeal to a niche audience looking for a different take on the real-time strategy genre, it fails to capture the attention of a broader player base. With its subpar graphics, unimpressive gameplay mechanics, and lack of ongoing support, [b]Boid[/b] struggles to stand out in a crowded market. Overall, it's a dull and forgettable experience for the genre.

[h1]One word or phrase to sum up the experience[/h1]
[i]Totally underwhelming.[/i]

[h1]Performance/Bug related incidents[/h1]
[i]None experienced during my playthrough.[/i]

[h1]Similar to games[/h1]
[i][b]Ashes of Singlularity[/b], [b]The Long Journey Home[/b], [b]Bannermen[/b][/i]

[h1]Rating ★★★★☆☆☆☆☆☆[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=869455135

author: {'steamid': '76561198011250864', 'num_games_owned': 1900, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1623792931}
review:
A nice concept, but very sloppy execution.

You control swarm type units and use them to assimilate and eliminate the enemy. You have places where base units are produced and these can be converted to other units for a rock paper scissors advantage. Main problem is controlling the units and their behavior. Controls are very clunky, movement and positioning isnt easy. The behavior of your units is also very inconsistent. When you position your units they may or may not decided to attack the nearby enemy. Sometimes they dont retaliate when youre attacked at all. Such bad control and bad Ai ruin the game.

Playing the campaign there are several types of mission. The puzzle types, where you need to use a limited number of units correctly or the eliminate enemy ones, where you need to produce the right amount of units to defeat the enemy. Sometimes you have a goal, like escort or gathering a certain amount of base units at a building. Variety is decent, I must say.

Story seemed kind of weird and the presentation element is simple.

The main selling point of this game is the gameplay. And its tedious. Thats why I wont recommend this to the majority of people. It turns into a slog for the most part due to the bad controls and weird AI.
This was for singleplayer, by the way. I dont know how the multiplayer is, but I doubt the issues are better there.

4/10

review: It's a very boiled down RTS. There's no base building, just fighting over pre-designated strategic points. I get that they are going for something very zen like here, but it's completely lacking in personality or sex appeal. That being said, if you are new to RTS and want something that's easy to learn and free to play, you may as well give this a go.

review:
Abstract RTS.  Start with spawn points that produce generic fighters and migrate them to take over other spawn points, as well as converters that will change fighters into different kinds of more specialized fighters.  Take over all enemy spawn points to win.  Can be played solo against bots or online against other players.  Includes a map editor for producing custom layouts.

Very nice for a free-to-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153994961', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1496675457}
review:
[b]Сквозь клубы стелющегося дыма, по дрожащей от взрывов почве, Локен бегом вел ветеранов Первого отделения на штурм лестницы, и пластальные подошвы их сапог загрохотали по камням. Первое отделение Десятой роты, тактическое отделение Хеллебора, гиганты в перламутрово-белых доспехах с эмблемой в виде черной волчьей головы на подвижных наплечниках. Из входных ворот на них обрушился шквал перекрестного огня. В ночном воздухе задрожали горячие струи от раскаленного оружия. Какой-то вертикально направленный автоматический миномет разбрасывал над их головами вязкие струи неизвестных зарядов.[/b]

[i]— Уничтожьте его! — услышал Локен на канале вокс-связи приказ брата-сержанта Джубала.[/i]

[b]Приказ был отдан на отрывистом жаргоне Хтонии, их родного мира; Лунные Волки всегда предпочитали использовать это наречие во время схваток.

Боевой брат, несущий на плече плазменную пушку, подчинился без всяких колебаний. Через какие-нибудь полсекунды от дула пушки до автоминомета протянулась двадцатиметровая огненная лента, а затем часть дворцовой стены скрылась за ревущей волной желтого пламени.

Взрыв разбросал в разные стороны десятки вражеских солдат. Несколько противников взлетели высоко в воздух и бесформенными грудами с переломанными костями рухнули на ступени.[/b]

[i]— Вперед, на них! — рявкнул Джубал.[/i]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/mars_original/recommended/371450/] continued here [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198387641965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1580595354}
review: Assez surpris de ce jeu , cela faisait a peu près 2 ans que je possédais ce jeu en n'y ayant jamais jouer , je l'ai tester et c'est plutôt sympa ! Le but est de conquérir des bases de "cellules" ennemies , tout en faisant attention à ne pas perdre ces territoires conquis précédemment , il y a un mode compétitif en ligne que je ne testerai pas car ça doit être un peu répétitif , d'ailleurs étrangement ce jeu me fait penser à MicroBot qui n'est pas du tout du même style mais je sais pas ça ressemble un peu quand même mais bon , assez surpris de cette découverte alors je recommande au moins pour 1h ou 2 de plaisir !

review:
很好玩的策略游戏~画面非常不错~全程发光水波特效~
游戏操作简单但策略性很强~强调各种兵种的分配对抗~
大多数情况下都要按需分配兵种~不能一股脑全用一种兵种~

但对我而言还是太难~更何况online~匹配后肯定是被虐咯~

author: {'steamid': '76561198188089663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2725, 'last_played': 1673623510}
review:
Неплохая маленькая игра, в которую я умудрился наиграть более 40 часов.
Учитывая что мультиплеерная часть (или игра с ботами) бесплатна, игру стоит попробовать. Графика и звук приятные, геймплейно все достаточно просто - нужно лишь самую малость разобраться.
Да и однопользовательскую кампанию можно брать не только в качестве поддержки разработчика. Парочка челенджей на некоторых уровнях гарантирована.
В общем однозначный плюс!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109119453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 495, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1545505670}
review:
As advertised, it's a rather simple strategy game. Instead of buildings you have capture points that either spawn or convert units. And then you just fight for control.

It's fine, although the inherent focus on micro over macro should come with better or clearer control possibilities. The GUI in general is not that great.

And of course it would be nice if it were avaiable on Linux. 

Definitely still an upvote of course, considering the price. This is a lot of enjoyable content for free, with a single player campaign for 5-10 bucks, depending on whether you buy it on sale. Check whether the servers for multiplayer are still populated before buying the singe player campaign, though, if you care for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281602651', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 6144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4444, 'last_played': 1704113374}
review:
Simple AI for when you need to unwind with "a cold-hearted, professional player" built into the game _-_
Seriously, there is no option for "easy" bots and the normal bots to some seem to me rather intelligent to me.
  There are 2 kinds of turrets, right?
 The renewable "gun(?)" turrets that assemble with 1-5 units (0 if you have SQD-69).
 And the non-renewable "tower" turrets which die forever once disabled.
their counter-units include:
1)crabs
2)gunners
3)kamikaze-mines

 So, crabs are used best via direct teleport onto the turret and take 15-20 of them to one-shot "gun turrets"
and 30-35 of them one-shot "tower turrets", but better test out 4 URself :L
 gunners don't matter, but chuck about 25/35 of them and about 5 will survive.
 kamikazes take 6 directly teleported onto a "gun turret" to disalble it, and 11 to disable a "tower turret"
Teleport spells are OP, if the AI didn't collect them where present, players would dominate 90% of the time.

Exploits to beating AI include:

unit groups of up to 2 (way out of the pathway of enemy units) don't pull agro, so good way to get vision.
Destroying "gun towers" and leaving them with 0 guns keeps them safe from enemy units, except for enemy SQD and gun units, as those are ranged princles and attack anything on sight.
keep contesting obgectives when they are not being used, use as little resources as posible.

2 poisons will destroy many of the mob strategies
3-4 kamikazes will do even better if dumped via teleport spells.

I usually cheat and make a safe base with a spawner and teleport spell unreachable to enemy units.

Note: these tips extensively cover only AI weaknesses. Humans are different.
Don't even get me started on the ranked system here, Bleugh XP

Humans are always less consistent than bots. Consistency in being good and being bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987468538', 'num_games_owned': 1409, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 4126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1434, 'last_played': 1692361038}
review:
Boid is real-time strategy at its most primal. No funds to manage or infrastructures to build. It’s a kill or be killed battle of rapid decisions to dominate the gene pool.

Kepler 42-C. A faraway planet of little significance. At least, it was until a malfunctioning drone crashed into its ocean, forever altering the course of life and inciting a battle to claim the planet, one microorganism at a time.

Claim vital positions to replicate and mutate into seven specialized units, such as the fast and vulnerable Scout, the explosive Kamikaze, and the life-draining Leach. Press your enemies for weaknesses, outflank their ambushes, usurp their bases, and amass an unstoppable swarm to overpower your adversaries.

This is more than a battle for your survival. It’s a fight for all life to come.

Fight to claim the planet in an 10-hour, single-player campaign
Available as DLC, the single-player campaign takes you on a journey to claim the planet and teaches you everything you need to succeed in multiplayer. Only the single player campaign is paid in BOID - everything else is free.

Create the perfect skirmish with bots and four difficulty levels.
Bots allow for easy practice in multiplayer matches.
Go online with ranked, unranked, and private 1v1 matches.
Featuring a full-on league system
The more you play, the more your list of Friends & Rivals grows.
BOID keeps track of your opponents for easy challenging
Create custom maps to share, and subscribe to your favorite creators.
A fully functional level editor allows you to create your own multiplayer maps

Color blind mode for heightened game accessibility.
Super easy to pick up gameplay, no base building to worry about - it's all about mutation and classes
Rock paper scissors style class system. Do you go for the heavy/strong/slow units or for the fast/weak/rush ones? 
Twitch Integration for multiplayer matches

review: Egy nagyon élvezhető játék, haverral nagyon vicces tud lenni és izgalmas. Irányíthatod a saját "seregedet" és megküzdhetsz a másik "sereggel". Először nem nagyon tetszett, de a kipróbálása után egy kellemese csalódásban volt részem, mert iszonyatosan megtetszett! Ajánlani tudom mindenkinek, aki szeret parancsolgatni és "haderőket" mozgósítani! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198090518625', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1508593391}
review: Una verdadera basura infecta. Uno de los peores juegos que he jugado en mi vida. Me ha estresado más que mis exámenes de Ecuaciones Diferenciales Ordinarias. No se de qué infierno saqué el juego pero preferiría haber comprado trampas para ratones y habérme pillado las axilas con ellas. No hay ser vivo capaz de pasarse una campaña más injusta, donde recibes mil ataques a la vez de celulitas mientras la maldita ballena que no se entera de su seguridad va como loca. ¡No he visto un solo gameplay en todo Youtube a más del 45% de este juego infecto! Si tienes algo de decencia, huye de este juego, por lo que más quieras...

author: {'steamid': '76561198136606820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1528713399}
review:
When I first bought this game it was a fun little game with nice attractive graphics. I just reinstalled the game to play again and I’m very surprised by what the developer has added; last time I played they had added multiplayer, this time there is a single player campaign. The game is very well made, very nice clean and attractive graphics with fun gameplay. The developer has exceeded my expectations!

It is a casual strategy game, great for casual play when you don’t feel like investing a lot of time into gaming. (My hours played is much higher than stated, probably from the restructuring).

author: {'steamid': '76561198079460764', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1488517034}
review:
Cute game, I'd say. I can say that I like this game because of it's gameplay as an RTS but then-again, it's a clone to other, real RTS games; but its still a great timekiller. The levels are progressively harder as you go onward into the game and there is somewhat of a story, but not much. You're constantly trying to defend/fend off your enemies so u can keep a certain point to create the enemies you want (from that specific point) to be able to kill the enemy easier. It's more of a 'search and destroy' kinda game, but others might disagree.

PROS:
+ Capture & Hold points and create units/transform units into better ones.
+ 'Search & Destroy' mechanic (sort of).
+ Variety of levels, all different difficulties.
+ Timekiller.
+ You can play with friends (last I checked you could).

CONS:
- Can get boring after awhile of playing.
- Some levels can be impossible to complete.
- Not a ton of variety in units in the beginning matches.
- Very repetitive at times.

8 out of 10, I might as well play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309649617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1517720538}
review:
自陣で生成されるユニットに指示を出して、敵陣を殲滅する形式のRTS。
操作はマウスが主で場合によってキーボードを併用します。多少の慣れは必要そうです。
日本語非対応ですが、ギミックやユニットタイプさえわかればプレイには支障がありません。

ふよふよ動くバクテリアのようなユニットがわらわら増えるのはなかなか楽しいです。ユニット数に特に上限も無さそうでリソース管理をあまり考えなくてよい点では、初心者も取っ付きやすいと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1503628197}
review:
Tags: Clicker - Swarmer
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Lackluster sprites and basic formula. Play Mushroom Wars instead.

Simple hotspot-capture clicker game where you control autospawned stuff and send it in swarms. Possibility to morph from one type to another at special hotspots. The underwater feel of the combat part of the game does not mesh well with the cybernetics and sci fi tone of the menus and mission fluff material. I found it more compelling than Galcon Fusion because of the art direction and undersea cavern level design. However it does not look feel nearly as immediately satisfying as Planets Under Attack. Still the core mechanics are solid enough. A lot of the menus had no capitalization at key places and were just simple font on transparent panes. A pane on the right hand site of the screen shows how many units of each type you control at any given point. The sprites for the creatures you spawn feel like placeholder art.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/431250/Mushroom_Wars/

author: {'steamid': '76561198107378056', 'num_games_owned': 1517, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 2319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1350, 'last_played': 1490425324}
review:
5/10 Beautiful RTS; weak GUI; bad AI units (your own)

So, this is F2P for multiplayer; pay for the solo single player campaign.  I do not see any other DLC temptations or microtransactions.  Play MP for free--why not?  I played the solo campaign only.

Spawn camps happen automatically after you capture for your team.  Then, the gathering location can easily be set on the class converter: Ranged, strong-Slow Melee, weaker-Fast Melee, Bombs, Healers.  Units can be converted at any time by sending them to the appropriate converter.

Look at the screenshots; the graphics are nice.  However, the melee unit has curved pincers like a crab, the ranged unit has flat beetle wings.  So, when zoomed out a bit as you must, the two units are almost indisguishable.  Not good.

The basic mechanical balance of the fighting is somewhat Rock Paper Scissors.  RANGED units beat SLOW MELEE; SLOW MELEE beats FAST MELEE; FAST MELEE beats RANGED.  There are quick select icons to the right to select ALL of a certain class in your army--5 or hundreds.  However, this is often completely useless.  Because of the RPS fighting mechanic, you must mostly create a mixed fighting unit.  Singularly focused groups can be quickly decimated.  Like any RTS, you may window select a group and ctrl-5 to set a groups hotkey to 5.

Unfortunately, when directing groups they will go to where you indicate, grouping up like morons, ready for 1 bomb unit to kill most all of them.  So, I spent much time trying to individually spread out a group to patrol and defend an area.  Unfortunately, units are created and killed at such a pace, that you will have difficulty trying to keep pace with any sort of assigned patrol (spinning in tight circles.)  And, on many occassions, I watched as my assigned units would spin in idiotic circles as enemies moved slowly by, refusing to fight.  There is no feature to specify Hold ground; Attack only when Attecked VERSES Attack anything within AGRO range.  Ranged units seemed to agro and fire on anything in range, but would get swarmed and killed as friendly allies would spin in circles close by, doing nothing.  Idiotic AI quickly ruins a game as it did BOID.

I finished the campaign on the easiest of the 3 difficulties (Normal).  The unreasonable execution of the GUI and AI made this quite challenging and a chore, desperately trying to seperate and locate 100 units.  The Enemy has an unfair advantage at first as you set up a base and defend.  Once a successful defense is formed, the speedy spawning precipitates an easy steamrolling victory.

But it is free for MP--you cannot be dissapointed too much in a free game.  Dont like it?  Junk it.  It is not a P2W teaser.  

5/10  Do not pay more than $1 for the Solo, Single player experience. If your units will not behave in Solo play, they will not work any better in MP.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1491702395}
review:
Boid is a Free to Play RTS game with simple gameplay.  It worked on Win 10, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok.  Only the Multiplayer modes and Solo matches with Bots are Free.  There is a tutorial map you can play in the Solo with AI mode. You have to buy the single player DLC campaign as extra.  Controls are your mouse only.  The user interface could use more improvement.   Has Map making mode.  Has steam acheivements.

Try it, if you like PVP with RTS games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116065442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1486405614}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077718707', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1560786514}
review:
[i]Прежде всего обмолвлюсь, что я не переношу скирмиши в стратегиях, потому в эту степь и не лез. Да и желающих потягаться хорошо если с десяток. Залипал в кампании, доставшейся бесплатно.[/i]

Также, по какой-то загадочной причине я имел графику следующего вида. Режим цветовой слепоты я выставил самостоятельно, а вот изображения юнитов и миникарта пострадали не по моей вине. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=845459545
"Оригинальная" картинка выглядит вот так: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=845459342
Починить это дело мне удалось уже после прохождения кампании, от которой я всё же получал определённое удовольствие. Теперь же к делу.

[quote][h1][b]Похвально:[/b][/h1]

● Игра красивая и атмосферная. Всё такое сияющее и прилизанное, к тому же обильно сдобренное симпатичными частицами и анимациями. 

●  Музыка хороша, отлично гармонирует с визуалом.
[/quote]

[quote][h1][b]Спорно:[/b][/h1]

● Игровой процесс невероятно медлительный и репетативный, что вынуждало меня проходить кампанию в несколько подходов с большими паузами.

● ИИ, надо признать, макрит отменно и очень назойливо. Тягаться с ним достаточно утомительно.

● Довольно-таки увлекательно выбивать "модули BOID" за дополнительные задачи, но, учитывая их специфику, приходится пробовать снова и снова, и на этом я плавно перехожу к следующей секции.
[/quote]

[quote][h1][b]Негодно:[/b][/h1]

● Долбанутая система автосохранений, делающая запись строго раз в две минуты. 
[code]Вот к чему подобные извращения, да ещё и с таким промежутком? Нет бы разрешить сохраняться вручную, но, допустим, с таймером в минуту до следующей возможности сделать сейв. Однажды игра сохранилась за секунду до смерти ключевого юнита, только этим обеспечив мне откат прогресса в несколько минут.

Забавно (вовсе нет), что я обнаружил наличие автосохранений почти что к концу кампании. То бишь, ошибаясь в миссиях с допами, я всегда перепроходил их заново, м-да. [/code]

● Куцая обучающая миссия с минимумом информации. О тех же автосейвах там ни слова, и много ещё о чём.

● Скорость движения группы юнитов не координируется. В частности, более быстрые медики вырываются вперёд всей процессии. Очень напрягает.

● Миникарта ужасно мелкая, чёрт что разберёшь.

● Тактические возможности не до конца продуманы.

● Сюжет кампании написан откровенно на отвали, да и нарисован тоже не ахти как.

● Касательно мертворождённой сетевой части, ей бы пришлось к лицу наличие чего-нибудь кроме дуэлей.
[/quote]

[h1][u][b]Итого:[/b][/u][/h1] Идейная основа данной игры — соревновательная — вполне закономерно не взлетела. Кампания довольно-таки невзрачная и, как ни банально, не стоит своей цены. В сухом остатке имеем медитативную картинку и нетривиальную задумку с трансформированием юнитов. Скудновато.

review:
Haven't played that much but this reminds me of Phage Wars 2 (http://armorgames.com/play/4013/phage-wars-2?rt=l ) ;
It's pretty fun ; cons: Kind of unclear whats the stats on the initial spawner unit(I've yet to find out), you gotta hover over the unit conversion bubbles to see stats on other ones (would be way better to display it on the top right) , from my experience bombs are ridicolously strong unless you excessively micro around them while the bomb user just clicks once and boom profit lol worst case scenario he gets a 1 for 1 , most usual scenario he gets 1 for 4 worst case scenario ... you pretty much lose the game because of one or two bomb units.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3471, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1479065100}
review:
Boid ist ein Free-to-Play Echtzeittaktikspiel das mich auf faszinierende Weise etwas an Z erinnert, da ich keine Basen baue sondern "Produktionsplätze" einnehme und dort dann weitere Truppen produziert werden. Das Spielprinzip ist einfach aber fesselnd und wird schnell sehr knackig in der Schwierigkeit was die "Truppen" organisieren angeht und die Balance zu finden zwischen Verteidigung und Angriff. Das Stein-Schere-Papier-Prinzip der Einheiten passt auch. Free-to-play ist das Spiel aber eigentlich nicht wirklich, das Spiel selbst ist kostenlos aber man kann sich eine Singleplayer Kampagne als DLC kaufen. Faire Sache. Generell halte ich Boid wirklich für eine Perle unter den zahlreichen kostenlose bzw. Free-to-Play Titeln auf Steam die ich mich mittlerweile gesehen habe. Ein schönes Spiel, gefällt mir ausnehmend gut.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-VrRPqy7jS8

author: {'steamid': '76561198243931284', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1546628482}
review: the gameplay itself is amazing and i would actually really like this game, if it were not for the visual glitches. I'm not sure if they were put there on purpose, (the occasional screen glitch, like looking through a camera) it would be a cool visual experiance; however, the screen constantly freaks out and lags, whenever something is being attacked, and sometimes, the map wont load and I can only see the spawn points and other things you can capture. This is a ridiculous ammount of visual glitches, WAY too much for an amazing game like this. If you are planning on playing this game, i suggest waiting until the developers fix these glitches

review: Boid is a game based on destorying other cells/worms/whatever you call them, and taking over other spawn points Violence:If little tadpoles bumping into each other violence there really is none at all. Language: There only is language in the campaign ,but that's about it :) Gameplay: requires some strategy and thinking, other units have pros and cons and can destroy others more easily. Overall the game should really be for around 7 because it needs some thinking really quickly and in multiplayer other players won't what and destroy you.

review:
Another Eufloria concept. It was ok, not overly fun. I liked that units could be placed outside of nodes, unlike the games this concept was stripped from. Other than that, its not really anything new. The units form a R-P-S gameplay that I found boring, but others might consider strategy.

After a few maps, I wasn't really interested in playing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317960664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1468782244}
review:
I have been following Boid for quite sometime, the game is a fun tower defense game. With very nice visuals, nice music and fun gameplay. On the tip of the iceberg it looks like a very simple game, but it's so much more than how it looks. Timing is the key, there is a lot of strategic planning for you to employ when you're playing. 

This is a very simple game to learn, with very nice level design, pretty good base mechanic, and a brilliant art

author: {'steamid': '76561198198030491', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1471427166}
review:
Неспешная, атмосферная игра, которая вас расслабляет. Если вы хотите динамики, то игра не для вас

author: {'steamid': '76561198049155148', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1472458757}
review:
[h1]Об игре:[/h1]
[list] 
[*]Неспешная, атмосферная игра, которая вас расслабляет. Если вы хотите динамики, то игра не для вас
[*]Основа геймплея заложена еще в Dyson (которая переросла в игру Eufloria). Есть точка спауна юнитов и вы грамотным спамом должны отбивать и захватывать другие точки спауна

[/list] 

[b]Настоятельно рекомендую к установке! [/b]

[h1]Факты относительно одиночной кампании (DLC):[/h1] 
[list] 
[*]Это набор миссий, связанных призрачным сюжетом (в виде комиксов) для одиночной игры 
[*]В начале каждой миссии вам указывают что нужно делать (брифинг в 4 строки) 
[*]Попутно нас обучают, подробно рассказывая обо всех особенностях тех или иных юнитов 
[*]Сами этапы выглядят как "Зачисти уровень от всего живого","Проведи горстку юнитов из точки А в точку В" или "Уничтожь/защити определенный объект на карте" 
[*]За выполнение дополнительных задач по миссии [spoiler]а-ля пройти уровень за 3 минуты[/spoiler] дают модули которые усиливают ваших юнитов 
[/list] 
[b]Рекомендую покупать сие DLC только фанатам игры
 [spoiler]или по скидке, как это сделал я (﻿ ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) [/spoiler] [/b] 

PS. [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/nCourage/myworkshopfiles/?appid=314010&sort=score&browsefilter=myfiles&view=imagewall][h1]->ТУТ<-[/h1][/url] можно загрузить мои карты для этой игры

author: {'steamid': '76561198056996286', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1877, 'last_played': 1471813730}
review:
Fun cool RTS game. Simple interface and very strategic.
  
Match making sucks. Nothing like being new just to get reamed by players with thousands of games under their belts. I like it but not enough to be some other player’s punching bag on a regular basis.  If you like queuing against the same high level player game after game to get your ass kicked this game is for you.   

This game has about 10,000 registered users according to its ranking lists.  Over 8,000 of these users are the lowest rank.  Why?  Refer to my punching bag remark above.  The bottom line is that this would be a fantastic game if match making were more refined. New players shouldn’t be going up against players in the highest tiers of the game with thousands of games to their name. It’s because new members get their ass kicked repeatedly upon first trying the game that they get turned off by it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251675774', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1689, 'last_played': 1513242585}
review:
Гра дуже сподобалась.Хоча й зашвидка для мене ;)
Я люблю подумати,а ця гра складається з моментальних рішень.Хоча один спосіб є - потрібно пройтись по кожній карті у грі з ботами і виробивши тактику швидкої перемоги слідувати їй,а вже у разі невдачі приймати ці самі швидкі рішення(Надіюсь я не заплачу своїм рейтингом за цю підказку;))
Натрапив на BOID ненароком і він привернув увагу спочатку наявністю лише двох мов - англійської і ... УКРАЇНСЬКОЇ ...
Це мене здивувало,оскільки ні про авторів ні про гру ще нічого не знав,тож подумав що це якісь локалізатори випередили усіх.А коли порився в мережі то був здивований ще більше гра то наша !
Тобто я в курсі що в нас іноді роблять чудові ігри і тому подібне.Та тут можливо ефект посилився від несподіванки.
І як у випадку з Gremlins,Inc у цієї гри є певні стислі стильові рамки які дозволяють називати її у цих межах ідеальною.Тобто у іграх які тягнуть на реалізм та складність завжди знайдеться те що ще би хотілось тут в них додати а у цих іграх такого відчуваєш.Просто був би радий якимсь невеликим розширенням,доповненням та можливо детальнішій статистиці.Та ще детальнішу інформацію по використанню юнітів.Хоча я особисто вже й так розібрався та було б простіше входити в курс діла прочитавши не лише параметри описані в грі.
Та все ж зовсім без мінусів не обійшлось.Я з задоволенням хотів підтримати розробників і зіткнувся з такою кумедною дилемою - а придбати то нічого толкового за гроші не можна !!!
Тобто є звісно кампанія однак там вказано що немає української.Звісно,думаю тамтешній текст я б зрозумів та все ж якось обідно - виходить розрахунок на те що платитимуть лише іноземці,от для них і мова(((
А наліпки,ну...я візьму якусь з найдорожчих просто з вдячності розробникам та на ділі вони не являють собою ніякої цінності - це навіть не авторські роботи а звичайнісінькі значки біо-загрози,хім-загрози,зірки та інш. яких сотні в мережі...Виходить платиш 1-5 доларів лише за функцію впихання загальнодоступних символів на твою базу в грі...безглуздо
Я б продавав усю колекцію наліпок за 3 долари.Це було б хоч якось оправдано.

Усе ж інше тут чудово.
І я одозначно рекомендую цю надшвидку стратегію любителям швидких рішень та простого геймплею.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966913375', 'num_games_owned': 1010, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1468025525}
review:
Online multiplayer and skirmish games are both free; purchasing the game grants access to the fairly standard campaign mode. There is a map editor, but no randomized maps (there are plenty of maps included, though). The interface could be improved: tool-tips appear entirely too slowly, counters are not indicated on the aforementioned tool-tips, the minimap is useless, and you can’t zoom in or out. Units are unique in appearance, although they fall into general categories (fast, ranged, healer). There are hard counters in the game for the basic units (guns beat crabs beat scouts beat guns) and turrets that can be captured to freeze, fight, or revert enemy units to their basic form. Units auto-attack while moving, but do not move as a group, resulting in a lot of micromanagement. Difficulty in managing units is compounded by the fast pace of the game; typically, one wrong move (such as losing a large battle, or losing units to a neutral location) is enough to do you in, as the AI is adept at the mechanics. While the campaign isn’t really worth the cost, those who can handle simplified, fast-paced real-time strategy games have nothing to lose in downloading the free skirmish and multiplayer modes.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sOSsgn5tHqU

author: {'steamid': '76561198074553150', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1470311660}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1815, 'playtime_forever': 6841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1661071632}
review:
O jogo é incrível, rico em estratégia. As partidas são dinâmicas, tensas quando pega alguém do seu nível, mas curtas o suficiente pra não estressar com o tempo que leva para ter um vencedor.

De primeira já dá pra ver que o jogo impressiona no gráfico para seu estilo. Sons na medida certa, indicando tudo de importante que acontece, mas sem poluição sonora.

Diversas estratégias com combinações diferentes por cada mapa único deixam espaço para surpresas e variedade no combate. Cada tipo de unidade é bem melhor pra certas tarefas, mas todas são fundamentais.

Cada decisão tática é importante, desde capturar aquela magia o quanto antes e mandar a unidade pra ver o que o outro está fazendo até decidir qual tipo de unidade habilitar primeiro.

Até unidades e comandos individuais fazem grande diferença. Uma bombinha faz a rapa de quem está perto... sem falar que mandar um grupo pra cima dos médicos vai fazer toda a diferença.

Por enquanto o jogo online tem apenas 1v1, seja humamo ou bot, mas tem a campanha solo do DLC que aparenta ser bem legal (eu não joguei, me contaram).

Não deixe de fazer o mapa tutorial (escolha contra bot e terá este, com instruções) para sacar o básico.

Nem tenha medo de jogar ranqueada, pois vai cair, na maior parte das vezes, com o pessoal também novato, pois todo m undo começa com zero pontos e não tem como ficar negativo.

Me adicionem! Muito bom duelar com o pessoal. Extremamente divertido e altamente viciante! Você pode jogar tanto contra os Bots (pra ir praticando) como contra outros jogadores (aí o bicho pega).

I recommend this game! a simple game, challenging, and that makes the player go crazy to win.

I really enjoyed the gameplay, sounds, effects .. everything.

I just think the mouse a little slow, a setting for the mouse sensitivity would be nice.

Thank you for create this amazing game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026265698', 'num_games_owned': 1701, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1469838286}
review:
Рекомендация [ ] Отзыв [√] Оценка [50/100]
Если ранний фритуплей сидел тупо на кортах и семки лузгал за углом с гопнической физиономией и даже за любой отжим афйона, по уставу братков, завсегда полагались ну хоть пара, но все же бонусов, их жертвам...
Здесь/Тут - это - не тут/здесь :)
Заплатил бабло за сингл, сиди неполживо в самом сингле и не рыпайся.
Мутко, сиди и играй дальше :)
Тебе, вообще - ничего тут не положено, ибо ты "одноручник".

А вобще, это очень хорошее перерождение игры, прородителя подобного жанра - Galcon Fusion (+хорошо реализованный Planets Under Attack), за что - ОГРОМНЫЙ плюс!

Но, в итоге, все же - ОГРОМНЫЙ! минус. ЗА - ВСЕ! (и за донат, тоже)

ЗЫ. "Простапруф" "#зачтоминус" - http://steamcommunity.com/id/DDfans/screenshot/448490901519352564

review: 很有趣的游戏，不需要看懂多少单词也能玩，但还是期待有汉化，不然很难向宿舍的人安利。一个人玩这游戏还是没大家一起玩有意思，有汉化后各种地方也就方便得多了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025875601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1535947645}
review:
We were surprised by how much fun this game was once we got the hang of it! The game was intuitive and challenging! Honestly I had more fun with this free game (free at the time of this review) than I have had with a lot of games I have paid a premium for. 

Pros:
Clean graphics
Easy controls
Actually difficult Bot opponents! 
Basic Strategy that quickly gets more involved. 

Con:
My only real downside is in the tutorial it was a bit difficult to figure out exactly what it wanted us to do. Not so bad that it hurts my view on the game, but I struggled a bit at the very beginning. 

If you want to see our initial reaction to the game you can view it by following the link below.. but really this game is awesome and if it is still free just download it.

Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T0-0-61DE84

author: {'steamid': '76561198121992725', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1469682691}
review:
This game reminded me of an old flash game I used to play when I was a lot younger. 

That is about the only positive thing that I can say about this game.

So this game claims to be free, there are no card drops from this game so you have to manually buy the cards of the market (how does that even work?) 
This game will NOT work on windows 10 so that kinda sucks because it screws with the screen when you do. I do have to admit this is an interesting concept of a game and I do enjoy RTS games every now and then. But the thing that tipped me off was that you have to buy a 10 $ DLC for the game just so the DEVs make more money off of you. There are some dumb microtransactions in the game.

Recomendation: Just sell the game for the same ammount that all the DLC combined is and then put the DLC in the game instead of letting them play the game and then getting a DLC to allow you to play the story mode and to me it just simply was not fun. My final rating for this game is a 3/10 Do not play this game.

review:
Дуже захоплива гра наперший погляд може здатися що вона казуальна але це не зовсім так. Під час змагань з іншими гравцями потрібно розуміти мапу і мати добре уявлення про те що треба робити. Є місце і для стратигічної думки и тактичних маневрів з різними юнітами.

Карт досить багато. І є можливість створити свою (хоча я ще не спробував) 


ps
Є проблема на мій погляд з низькою ефективність рейдерскіх захоплень. Бажаю мати з них білше зиску )))
pps
Я саме скінчив читання трилогї "Ender's Game" ця гра мені нагадала першу гру в якій гг грав коли тільки прилетів до вчилища.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028100581', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1468965638}
review:
Boid ist ein forderndes Echtzeitstrategiespiel für kurze und spannende Runden. Ein Spiel dauert selten länger als zehn Minuten und ist von der ersten bis zur letzten Sekunde hochgradig spannend. Jeder Spieler startet mit den gleichen Voraussetzungen und man entscheidet einzig und allein mit seinen eigenen Fähigkeiten über Sieg und Niederlage. Durch die gute Einbindung in Steam sind Spiele schnell gefunden und Karten können mit wenigen Klicks geteilt werden. Ich kann Boid jedem Freund von Strategiespielen uneingeschränkt empfehlen.

Für ein umfangreicheres Review kannst du gerne bei http://videospielkombinat.de/boid-echtzeitstrategie-in-reinform vorbeischauen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972236054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1470351998}
review:
Free multiplayer. Very nice graphics, relaxing to watch. Easy controls, intuitive concept, fun gameplay, nice chill drum and base music.
Perfect multiplayer for when you want to kill 5 minutes without having to think too much and still have fun. The battle can grow very intense sometimes though, depending on yours and your opponents "skill" (at some point, game speed increases by 50%. which is plus for me).

I consider this game a very nice discovery, would recommend.

review: This game may be an RTS, but it isnt the best RTS, and it isn't really close, You can rush in Boid, no tactics like a true RTS would have, no strats, just making a hundred crabs and rushing the enemy, on every map, i am sad, because this could've turned into a really cool game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050838178', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1572517289}
review:
Boid is a very, very easy to understand casual RTS game, yet it has complexity.
There are zones which create units, units can be mutated into a variety of more specialized units, usually fast ones, tanky ones, ranged units, explosive units, sometimes poisonous units and medics... ocasionally you also get a super-ranged-reincarnating-explosive-giant-squid.
There are also a couple of powers which can be casted locally.

Multiplayer is free, and works flawlessly, the game has pleasing graphics, fair/good music and no apparent bugs.

Must try for every anxious RTS lover, its simplicity makes it a very good casual game kind of like playing speed chess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026155518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1468894706}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095585556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1468956487}
review:
Стратегия от человека, который никогда не играл в RTS, никогда не делал RTS и не умеет делать RTS. В результате, то что планировалось как новаторство, выглядит как полный идиотизм и только запутывает.
Красиво писть не умею, поэтому опишу все, что не не понравилось в небольшом списке:
- В нормальных играх карта располгается слева. Это стандарт жанра. Зачем было перетасккивать ее вправо?
- Также, в нормальных играх твой цвет и цвет твоих врагов никогда не меняется. Ты всегда зеленый, а враг - всегда красный. Здесь же реально бесит, что ты то красный, то зеленый.
- Почему бои только на двух игроков? Это же RTS, а не карточная дуель. Вся прелесть RTS в хороших боях 2 на 2 или 4 на 4, когда нужно помогать друг-другу. 
- Абсолютно не понятно по какому принципу работают абилки. Обычно такие вещи рассказывают в туториале, но не здесь.
- Туториал вообще крайне убогий. Не рассказали даже, что можно задать точку в которую юнит будет следовать после рождения.
- Крайне странный список "Друзья и соперники". Зачем мне видеть каких-то случайных чуваков с которыми я сражался в случайном матче в одном списке с моими дузьями?
- Даже юниты одного типа при движении вытягиваются в линию, и не могут атаковать толпой. Приходится перемещаться маленькими "рывками".
- Принцип по которому подбираются противники в рейтинговых матчах абсолютно непонятен. В большинстве, мне новичку предлагают противников с рейтингом на несколько сотен выше. Это все-равно что выпустить профессонального боксера тяжеловеса против новичка, который впервые взял в руки перчатки. 
Молдец, что сказать.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970809692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1468267550}
review:
I tend to recommend most games that are free unless they are horrible.  Boid is an interesting little game.  I do not, however, think it is currently classified correctly.  Boid is more like a MOBA that had a baby with an RTS.  It does not have levelable heroes like most MOBA but it autogenerates little troops that go along little pathways and the maps are very MOBA like with lanes and what not.  The RTS elements are that rather than having predefined lanes that these autogenerated troops go down, you manipulate the pathways to convert standard units to more specialized forms and then to take over enemy nodes.  That's it.  It's a MOBA with no heroes where you change the pathways of the grunt troops and watch it all unfold.  

It doesn't have a lot of the standard aspects of an RTS:
1. No resources to collect and manage other than the capture points
2. No technology tree to customize your loadouts and skills for your units.
3. No building, base creation or deployable defense structures of any kind.
4. No assignable squad numbers to manage your units - this is as basic as RTS mechanics get.
4. No patroling mechanisms, attack toggling, etc. - I had enemy units go right past mine and they did nothing - there is no way to set units with certain behavioral macros.
5. No special units with unique skills that must be proc'ed by the player.
6. Absolutely no terrain differences that require specialized units (IE land, air, water, etc.)


Does it take strategy?  Yeah.  I imagine if I play a little longer, layers of complexity will be revealed in terms of what troops you want to produce to counteract what the other players are doing.    In the end, Boid is elegant and simple.  I can imagine some people would get really into things like this, I just prefer something with more substance.  Give it a spin.  You'll know if it is something you're into or not in about 5-10 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077185468', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1468155354}
review:
Not my cup of tea. From the start it feels like what it is, a low-budget production. The sounds are extremely annoying and after having finished the tutorial, I wasn't motivated to keep on playing. I'll stick to Starcraft 2 if I need my RTS dosage from time to time. MP matches are decided quickly: the player that controls the most spawners wins. The rest is just Rock, Paper, Scissors unitwise. There is no base building in this game, just capping points and rushing enemy base. This lacks tactical depth!

Another big minus is that the MP part and botmatches may be free, but the campaign is added DLC, which I think is not worth getting after what I've seen.

If you are interested, try it since it's free, but don't expect too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000541629', 'num_games_owned': 2503, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1564089270}
review:
O jogo é incrível.

As partidas são dinâmicas, tensas quando pega alguém do seu nível, mas curtas o suficiente pra não estressar com o tempo que leva para ter um vencedor. De primeira já dá pra ver que o jogo impressiona no gráfico para seu estilo. Sons na medida certa, indicando tudo de importante que acontece, mas sem poluição sonora.

Diversas estratégias com combinações diferentes por cada mapa único deixam espaço para surpresas e variedade no combate. Cada tipo de unidade é bem melhor pra certas tarefas, mas todas são fundamentais. Cada decisão tática é importante, desde capturar aquela magia o quanto antes e mandar a unidade pra ver o que o outro está fazendo até decidir qual tipo de unidade habilitar primeiro.

Não deixe de fazer o mapa tutorial (escolha contra bot e terá este, com instruções) para sacar o básico. Até unidades e comandos individuais fazem grande diferença. Uma bombinha faz a rapa de quem está perto... sem falar que mandar um grupo pra cima dos médicos vai fazer toda a diferença.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118644957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1468097694}
review:
So i  just play a little bit of BOID and as a non-RTS fan i find it quite interesting BUT devs should add things!
Things that have more control on units like:
-Hold Ground
-Attack move   <~ This is a must i think!
I play with bots and all the time i have to select units and right click to move and attack and so on.
Another thing that the game needs is a BETTER tutorial. Its not that hard to understand the game but an explanation on units or on some tactics will not hurt anyone.
Maybe I spend some more time on this but I really want to see updates coming!
I recommend it though!
Keep up the good work devs.
Oh! that is my first ever review! :P

review:
The concept of the game is amazing and the game works smoothly but it feels repetitive after some time.
The things I feel missing from the game are:
1- 4 players maps.
2- Live chat with all online players.
3- A profile menu.
4- A way to feel like progressing in the game, like player levels maybe.
Other than that it is really a good game, I hope they Update it regularly with more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1468034304}
review: Boid is an RTS, a single cell RTS where your goal is not only to reproduce your creatures via spawners, but to mutate them into different combat forms to fill a variety of strategic roles.  Multiplayer and bot matches are free, but single player is a DLC. I feel like this model works to get people to try the game and jumpstart the community without having to drop a monetary commitment. I think Boid is pretty neat and I would recommend it to a variety of fans including RTS, strategy, multiplayer, mobile and a long list of others. If anything I have said sounds interesting give Boid a try.

review: It's actually a really polished, yet simplistic RTS game. I've owned this game for a while, and I haven't really played it much due to the lack of people that were on. Hopefully, with the new free to play rolling out, there will be more people on to play against.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027914477', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1475749152}
review:
Pretty nice game with beautiful graphics.
The gameplay is really more like a mobile game,very simple and not RTS-like but its fine and has a variety of units. It's sad that there is no building it all and everything is predertimend and the gameplay is basically just waiting for units to spawn and then command all units to go attack. But for a free game this is really nice and I can definitely recommend it, although it really plays like a mobile game :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198041420713', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1532189745}
review:
Рекомендую игру.
Стратегия, где есть идеальный баланс даже на пользовательских картах. Я создал карту, начал играть со сложным ботом. На пятой игре понял, как правильно играть на этой карте.
Повторюсь: это была моя карта.
В этой игре баланс - всё. Один игрок нарушил баланс - довольно трудно вернуться к прошлому состоянию.
Чтобы победить, надо разрушить баланс. Один скаут уничтожает двадцать бомб, бомба уничтожает двадцать скаутов. Контроль территории, хитрость, микро-контроль.
Очень хорошая стратегия, вот честно. Берите её.
(Минусы: мёртвый мультиплеер, несколько багов (которые, кстати, не фатальны))

author: {'steamid': '76561198085272009', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1472872972}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069388359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1468698901}
review:
BOID is a great game with nice looking graphics, it is highly tactical and competitive, but easy for anyone to get into.

Positives:
Simple but fun
Great looking
Good to play with friends

Negatives:
Networking is a little glitchy at times
If you don't have friends it will be hard to find a game since there aren't many people online most of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033094240', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1896, 'last_played': 1538336900}
review:
22/01/16

Really fun game, strateggy is done beautifully, i do recommend it, i just hope that the Dev team released something, an update, a notice, a post-it  or something, it's hasn't been updated for 9 months or so...

The game in single player is fairly fun, and micro managing is important up to the point where you get an advantage or an extra spawn, then the AI goes crazy and stops trying to push anything anywhere.

The Workshop was a really good adition, it keeps the game "fresh" of experiences. and the multiplayer really makes it a competitive game, although more than two playes would be nice.

I do wish to see a newer stuff... and because the lack of updates, i have to say DO NOT BUY this game UNTIL the developer releases another update. The last release was May 18th.

Update 03/06/16
Around 6 months after my original review, and the game is still the same, no a thing has changed, haven't checked if the Devs had say something, but i suspecto they haven't. Still a NO BUY, until a fresh update comes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984352683', 'num_games_owned': 1303, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1450987188}
review: Esse jogo em particular achei muito difícil de jogar mesmo no modo "easy", não consegui jogar online, pois não tive paciência de esperar os 133 min que estavam previstos para a espera, achei muito demorado isso. O jogo tem muitas variações de tipos de unidades que voce controla na tela e requer muita concentração, pois, se voce vacilar, perde o jogo porque a "IA" é muito rápída e esperta. Resumindo eu gostei do jogo pela diversidade de tipos, mas é meio chato o modo que voce passa de uma fase para outra, pois, não há uma sequencia sugerida e sim uma lista de fases para voce escolher. Quer ser esmagado pela "IA", então escolha o modo mais dificil que não da tempo nem de voce pensar numa estratégia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048187113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1496986816}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022934423', 'num_games_owned': 1215, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1450462895}
review:
-Versión 0.6.223
La idea para un juego de estrategia es buena,pero a la práctica le falta bastante para ser bueno del todo.Los controles son algo burdos,tan solo tiene modo escaramuzas,sin campaña (aunque por lo que he leído la añadirán en un futuro) y el online contra otros jugadores está prácticamente muerto.Si se sigue trabajando en Boid podría llegar a ser interesante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044510709', 'num_games_owned': 932, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1449874371}
review:
Boid es un RTS con diseño espacial, y esta vez el tan recurrido diseño planetario deja indiferente por su excesiva simplicidad. Si a esto le sumamos una alocada jugabilidad  y poca sensación de control pues el resultado es evidente, un producto con buenas intenciones pero mediocre en un totalidad.

Coste: 0,31 eur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232938348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1599060501}
review: Good game. I'd love to be able to recommend it to people who enjoy rts style games. However, for the second time since buying this game I'm having major issues with it. It no longer loads the game despite having tried the same fixes as before. My software and hardware are up to date, all requirements arev met but I am once again unable to play this. I may be one of the few who are experiencing problems but still, as much as I've gone through to play this, I can't say I would recommend this game until they fix this issue. I loved the game when I could play it. Great graphics, smooth gameplay on most maps, only issue came from overpopulation of bots on custom maps. It's not a bad game. Just has bugs that still need to be worked out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989795433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1449548760}
review:
So imagine you're playing another RTS game, like, say, Starcraft or Command and Conquer. 

Then strip away the detailed sprites, the intuitive and responsive controls and the intricate map. Done? That's Boid. 

What I mean is that the game designers have opted for a graphically simplistic RTS. And while it still looks good in it's way (kind of like neon sperm.... who doesn't like that?), it creates it's own set of problems: 


The minions move in swarms, which makes it difficult to distinguish between different classes of minions. Not that unit diversity is really noticeable anyway, but still....

The way point "dots" can be difficult to click on and move for some reason.

There is no way (that was made apparently by the tutorial at least) to hotkey select groups of minions... you can only select them by class, which makes directing your forces an exercise in frantic click-and-drag motions to separate and direct them accordingly. 

Add to these issues the fact that the AI is INSANELY fast and proficient in making an enormous force in about 10 seconds, while you're still desperately trying to drag the first way point to the predetermined spawn point.... the game becomes boring and repetitive very quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981357704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1448811828}
review:
I got this from a bundle on the sale, so wanted to try it out
Multiplayer only, which was a surprise, and something to keep in mind.

Did not get much gameplay, considering I couldn't stand the lag issue with my mouse, I'm not sure if this is a problem with my specific setup, but since I can run Fallout 3:NV and similar games that are pretty heavy, this smaller game shouldn't have this problem..

From the very little I saw otherwise, I would definitely give this game a try, were it not for that issue. As it stands though, I can't play it, so no recommendation unless you can handle mouselag and/or it's not an issue any longer

author: {'steamid': '76561197992130911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1468103014}
review:
I have just spent several hours with Boid,  a simplistic 2D RTS that has you take control of several amoeba like organisms in underwater cavernous environments and pits you against an equal foe located on the other side of the map. Brought to us by indie developer tinyBuild Games, also known for the satrical "No Time To Explain".

The idea is simple, take over all control points on the map before your opponent can. Control points are broken into two basic categories,  spawn points that slowly spawn new troops up to a maximum of five at a time, and evolution points which allow you to morph your creatures into various upgraded forms, like a strong crab like creature, a long range laser canon, and speedy scouts among other variations.  You are tasked with controlling your flow of new units while strategically choosing which path to take and which upgrades to use and balance everything accordingly. All actions are controlled by a simple click of the mouse, and a side panel gives you a brief summary of units available, and selected, and you can use waypoints to help automate some of your troops to specific defense points or upgrades to capture.

Both offline and online modes are already included in the most recent build. The offline version features a fairly good A.I. which can challenge new comers to the game and is a good way of getting acquainted with most of the unit types, and general gameplay. Multiplayer of course is where a game like this shines, as adapting to a human player's differing strategies and changes of pace are where the real challenge and fun is. With the recent addition of leagues, and ranked play, you can easily lose hours to Boid.

Graphically Boid's 2D graphics are simple, yet colourful and make it easy to identify unit types by their shape, as well as identify enemies. Winning and losing spawn points is shown graphically by quick flashes of light on the screen to give you a quick clue that you may need to investigate elsewhere. The submerged aquatic setting is full of life, and the lighting effects give great depth on what is otherwise a flat world.

Available now on the Steam Early Access program at a measly $3.29 CAD, Boid is a steal for anyone looking for an easy to pick up, but competitive RTS. One that is being well supported by the developer with regular updates and improvements.

www.micbemac.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198041950371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1496428545}
review:
Rating this game was tough. There are lots of great things about it, but I'm not sure if it is worth your time right now. Maybe in the future, it will get a boot kick.

BOID is a simplistic, yet still competitive RTS. It's simplicity allows the gameplay to be super fast paced, and allows even small decisions to make huge impacts in the game. It's chellenging, as there is no one path to victory. Pretty much every unit has some strength or weakness. You can use these to your advantage, or to your opponent's disadvantage; your choice.

Pros:
-Simple enough for anyone to pick up and play in a few short minutes.
-Diverse enough to allow complicated stategies for more experienced RTS players.
-Beautiful art.
-Custom map creator.
-New content every here and there.

Cons:
-Small, and very inactive community. It is near impossible to find someone to play with.
-Doesn't teach the player anything more than basic controls.
-Kinda glitchy (Especially map creator).
-Low redeeming value, unless you find friends to play with and experiment with strategies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005993615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1605115682}

I recommend buying it now to save some money since it'll only improve as time goes by.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042344608', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1567712429}
review:
This game looked a lot more fun... it really isn't.
And that's because there's no AI that can play on any map, no, you're stuck playing with people. Who will either be too easy, or too hard. And in this game, this is all it takes to win or lose.
So, no, in the end, I can't recommend it.

EDIT: There is now a single player campaign. It's a good campaign, with challenging levels. Good job! I can now recommend it.

review:
Boid is a very well thought out game, with each "Species" having some form of counter in either other species, or strategies to get around these problems (Gun beats Crab beats Speeder beats Gun being a good example of this). The ability to create your own maps makes the game that much deeper and fun.

The biggest problem with Boid right now is that hardly anyone seems to be playing, which makes actually playing it with anyone other than bots very rare which is super disappointing.

Please get this game so that more people are playing it!

review:
Playing this game really reminds me of two games (spore and EAW).
You start out with a bubble of basic units that look like 2cell organisams that do a decent amount of damage and you take other bubbles that chagne your 2cell organisams into manta rays, crab thingys, turrets(Jellyfish looking thingys) and you can also turn them into posious squids and big turret bubbles. anyways the game overall is pretty fun theres a lack in multiplayer but this is early access, so Im almost positive there put more maps and different game modes that more than just 2 people can play on. Hopefully there make it possiple for up to 8 people in one Huge Map!!!! XD anyways I give this game a 7/10 I hope this review is helpful for anyone who may want to buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993805040', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1682358180}
review:
Simply beautiful! Easy but deep mechanics, gorgeous graphics and fun multiplayer. This is NOT your typical "drag and drop more units than the enemy on a production facility" that plague mobile and web territory (I thought it was from the screenshots), it actually has depth! Do yourself a favor and try it out.

Edit 2023: Revisiting this now I'm a bit torn with my initial review. While it does have some nice ideas, the AI of the boids is very dumb and inconsistent and they will often times not engage in combat happening right next to them. They don't maintain any formation when moving and healers will lead the charge and die if you don't babysit them. This requires a lot of annoying micromanagement. The puzzle type mission where you have limited amounts of boids are just infuriating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974233070', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1430071963}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049748165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1470764067}
review:
(REVIEW UPDATED on July 19, 2015)

Fun simplistic RTS with 5-10 minute rounds. It's fast-paced and games can be quite tense.

The AI has 4 difficulty levels and is reasonably challenging. Class system, while being simple, provides enough variety for a lot of different strategies, and strategies that will work on some maps won't work on others - sometimes simply because there won't be "bases" that can turn units into a type that your strategy depends on. So game constantly encourages player to think of new ways of utilizing available units. And there is easy and flexible map editor.

Now a few words about multiplayer. Boid is clearly built with it in mind, it's really fun. As of now, there is 1v1 mode (and developers talk about implementing 2v2, 4 players FFA and perhaps something else - but I'm not sure if this is among official plans or just a possibility). Bad news about multiplayer is that it can take quite some time to find an opponent online. Good news is that you can play against AI while the game is looking for an opponent for you.

Developer actually listens to the community and not a small number of  frequently requested features and improvments has been implemented because of this.

I'd recommend Boid to people who aren't very good at RTSes but want some fast strategic/tactical fun - as I'm one of that bunch and game plays well :) Also Boid looks like a good entry point to real-time strategizing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013005714', 'num_games_owned': 6683, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1427918480}
review:
我是参与的最早的BETA测试，当时这游戏要素极少，地图也简单，很容易出现双方僵持的现象，现在似乎修改了不少，要素也增加了，战略方式更多。
这个游戏的最大亮点在于多线操作，玩到激烈的时候操作需要顾全大局，小错误经常会造成直接崩盘。

author: {'steamid': '76561198056811942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1514115691}
review:
A very beautifully designed 2D RTS. The art desing is gorgeous, the mechanics mirror those of classic RTS games and streamline the player's actions required to focus in the most thrilling aspects of the genre:

· Fast decision making.
· Macro and Micro managing.
· Army composition.
· Unit positioning.
· Scouting and Harassment.
· Combat.

Games are very fast-paced, and the deal may be sealed within a couple of minutes, but when both players manage to counter each other's strategies games can last for quite a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124869455', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1522962034}
review:
I like it! Every game feels like a zerg rush :D

little about it:
- it's only 1vs1 player
- a strategy game where in order to win you have to be faster than your opponent in conquering strategic points on the map and also be able to hold them.
- you do not controll the way your units spawn, the more spawning points you controll, the more units you produce, thus is essential to controll at least the same amount of spawning points as your opponent to be able to stay in the game.
- each "basic unit" (is actually a good unit, but average on all stats) can be transformed to different units if you controll certain points on the map. Each unit has its own advantages and drawbacks, some are faster but weaker, some are slower but stronger, some are weaker but have range, some heal, etc.
- at first it feels a little strange(slower mouse movement - but you can adjust it in options menu), game allows you to zoom out(you are able to see the entire map) but this zooming is used just for observing, you'll have to zoom back in to be able to controll your units. After playing some games, I got used to it and it seems natural now.

Pros:
- simple, very easy to learn but harder to master
- can be played "casual" as games can be really fast(minutes) so you don't need hours to play a game.
- low price

Cons:
- Almost no players to play against for now(still early access) so you'll be mostly stuck playing against bots(the hard difficulty is pretty challenging).. or you can always play against friends if you have them(I'm lonely)
- you can play only ~5 maps vs bots, while online there are more options ~20
- only 1v1. Maybe in the future it would bring a nice twist to be able to play it with more players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104804064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1483775647}
review:
顕微鏡で見るウィルスのようなユニットを増殖させ、属性を持たせて相手の陣を奪っていく陣取りゲームです。
リアルタイムで戦況が変化する中、ベースになるユニットをスピード重視、守り重視、遠距離攻撃、回復系等のユニットに変化させ
戦っていきます。
操作はいたって簡単で、動かしたいユニット達を左ドラッグで囲んで攻撃したい相手ユニット又は相手陣を右クリックで指定するだけ。
囲った中に色んな種類のユニットが混在していれば、あてがわれたキーボードで指定しながら特定ユニットを動かせます。
細い路地にレーザーユニット待機させ防衛線を張ったり、早いユニットで相手陣を偵察に行ったり（近づかないと見えない仕様）
色んなユニットを一箇所にたくさん集め,頃合を見て一気に攻め込んでみたり、
地形によって戦略性も駆け引きも変わってくる意外と奥が深いゲームですね。

author: {'steamid': '76561198037165091', 'num_games_owned': 1068, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1566038195}
review: Задумка игры напоминает линейку игр Red Alert. Но здесь у нас все сведено на минимум. Не сказать, что это плохо, поскольку все что нужно - захватить вражеские точки, при этом каких-то новых не может появиться. Юнитов не слишком много в игре, но и этого достаточно. Из режимов есть как оффлайн игра, так и по сети (есть даже ранговая игра). Но какой-то кампании в игре вы не увидете, правда игра была не под это заточено, а под мультиплеер. Своих 79 рублей игра стоит (хоть я и взял за 59).

author: {'steamid': '76561198065715499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1426788893}
review:
Приятная весьма игруля, атмосферой напоминающая Osmos и подобные ей "пузырьковые" игры)

Из плюсов:
+ Изумительная атмосфера: приятная гладкая картинка/анимация и подходящий саундтрек
+ Неплохой ИИ
+ Много разных режимов (пусть и отличаются они не сильно)
+ Редактор карт
+ Разнообразие юнитов
+ Стим-ачивки
+ Ранкед-система
+ Собственно, онлайн-режим. Ничуть не глючащий :З

Из минусов... Ну, сложно, на самом деле, сказать, какие минусы могут быть у игры за 59р со скидкой (хотя и без скидки, имхо, она стоит своей цены). Легче сказать, что еще можно было бы увидеть в игре, что сделало бы её более клёвой. Например, хотелось бы какое-то игровое развитие что ли, возможность прокачивать юнитов вне игры, ведь даже в играх жанра МОБА, помимо рейтинга, обычно имеется хотя бы малейшая возможность прокачки и кастомизации, а здесь же такого нет. Но пока что. Игра активно развивается и кто знает, что она из себя будет представлять через год-другой ^_^

Пока что именно в МИНУСЫ можно, пожалуй, отнести маленький онлайн (от 10 до 40 человек в среднем), но, тем не менее, ждать противника обычно долго не приходится - минут 5-10 максимум. Если сравнивать с МОБА-играми, то там эти 5-15 минут уходят не только на ожидание противника, но и на прогрузку, к примеру. Здесь же загружается всё весьма быстро и на это времени не уходит. Да и вообще сложно назвать это минусом, к тому же с ИИ играть не менее интересно, имхо.

Советую купить, если вы любите подобного рода игры по захвату + атмосферность х) Цвета в игре очень приятные. Покупала, чтобы сыграть буквально пару раз ночью, потестить интересность, так сказать, но, думаю, вернусь еще к этой игре не раз и не два. Как минимум, буду следить за обновлениями~

author: {'steamid': '76561198093941544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1425613991}
review: Boid is a rather simplistic game all together. It does require that you take time and plan out your moves for the future. If they added a co-op mode it would possibly give people a tad more enjoyment from the game. Also, if there was no fog of war (possibly for only a specific game mode), it would add more strategy. Without a fog of war, you would be able to determine which types of units you will need for future battles and it would lead to counter strategies and possibly more fun for the player. Just a thought though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1426370099}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

[quote] PLEASE NOTE: This review is/was written when this game was in/is still in Early Access. Think twice before buying/playing this game [/quote]

I have been following Boid for quite sometime, the game is a fun tower defense game. With very nice visuals, nice music and fun gameplay. On the tip of the iceberg it looks like a very simple game, but it's so much more than how it looks. Timing is the key, there is a lot of strategic planning for you to employ when you're playing.

This is a very simple game to learn, with very nice level design, pretty good base mechanic, and a brilliant art style!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]
