review:
This Game is a Master Piece

A lot of people these days turn down early access, because its had a very shady past as of late. well here one of the games that does it right the reason for the Dev putting this up for Early acccess is not to reap in all the cash, its so you as a player can help him continue his project and make the game a decent experince,

an amazing RTS anyone could love

author: {'steamid': '76561198008088676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1670850536}
review:
The early access bit:

TL;DR - It's an excellent game, well worth the price of admission. Everything seems to work, and work well.

This is a very simple to learn RTS, with good level design (thus far), a pretty good base mechanic, and a brilliant art style (literally and figuratively, the lighting is a bit intense).

The basic premise is that you control a constantly-spawning highly mutable lifeform, and by taking and holding various points around the map you gain access to different sets of abilities for your units. Basic units spawn at a constant rate, and the biggest challenge lies in determining what to turn them into and where to attack. Resource management boils essentially down to "how long do I wait before expanding", which is a simple enough thing to measure.

The good stuff:

As I've said, the art design is excellent. Seriously, everything is pretty clear in its function at a glance and the game looks gorgeous.

It's got a really intuitive interface. Even novice RTS players should be able to pick this up and figure out just about everything extremely easily.

Speedy matches aren't something I'm used to in any RTS. It's nice to be able to knock out a quick game or two instead of an hours-long slog sometimes.

It's quickly engaging, and the additional features that are supposed to make that even better.

The downsides:

If you're looking for something with a lot of depth, look elsewhere. There aren't lots of resources to juggle, there's no campaign, it is exactly what it appears to be.

It's really heavy into micromanaging units for a sizeable portion of each game. Towards the end it can get a bit more macro, but misplacing half a dozen guys (not tough to do) can have pretty dire consequences early on.

Momentum is massively important. This isn't a negative thing necessarily, but it becomes pretty clear pretty quickly who has the advantage in a battle. It's possible to come back if you're behind, but there's an obvious tipping point.

You can't control units while you're zoomed out. That's a bit of an odd design decision and I'm sure there's a reason for it, but it's a little bit frustrating.

All in all this is extremely well done, and for the price you seriously can't beat it for entertainment value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119760514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1629576248}
review:
So Boid.

I came across this game when I was browsing and decided to sign up for the beta as it looked like fun.

I've played it for quite a while and I absolutely love it. On the surface it looks very simple, but it's so much more. Timing is everything, there's so many different strategies for you to employ when you're playing.

If you want to play a game for a bit of fun, this is the game for you, I'd highly recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121418632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1485713028}
review:
З розробниками ігри, компанією Mokus ми познайомились ще в 2011 році. Тоді вони випустили шедевральну Contre Jour, яка стала хітом спочатку на iOS, а потім ще й на Android та Windows Phone.Пройшло більше 4 років і нам представили альфа-версію своєї нової гри - Boid.

   Що таке Boid? Boid - це суміш RTS та стратегії, в якій вам потрібно за допомогою домінуючої форми життя взяти під контроль всі бази на карті. В грі вам прийдеться дуже швидко приймати рішення, оскільки навіть декілька секунд можуть вирішити хто пан, а хто пропав. Не існує єдиної правильної тактики для здобуття перемоги, вам прийдеться взаємодіяти з елементами, які знаходяться на карті, збільшувати чисельність своєї армії та координувати їх рух. Гра володіє красивою та м'якою графікою та прекрасним звуковим супроводом. В майбутньому ми отримаємо редактор карт, який дасть змогу створювати свої мапи для гри з друзями.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013119250', 'num_games_owned': 2232, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1453231238}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jVvxnq8SY6M
[b]Kliknij i rozwiń, by przeczytać wszystkie zalety i wady tej produkcji.[/b]
Na początek warto zaznaczyć - jest to produkcja małego studia zrobiona za niewielkie fundusze. Jak zresztą widać - cena gry ustalona na 3€ w wersji przedpremierowej. Szacunek do gracza jest - gra prosta, cena niska. Jest nieźle. Jeżeli chodzi o samą rozgrywkę - dowodzimy "oddziałami" bakterii lub innych mikroskopijnych form życia. Mamy tryb z botami oraz tryb sieciowy - do dyspozycji na początku mamy standardowe i proste istoty, które po przejęciu punktów strategicznych mogą zmienić się w różnorodne inne blopsy. Jakie wady ma ten tytuł? No cóż... Brakuje jej promocji, tryb sieciowy jest praktycznie "zerowy" - nie ma tam graczy, ciężko znaleźć jakiś rozmach w tym tytule. Gra jest przyjemna i ciekawa, ale niestety maksymalnie na dwa-trzy dni.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043919366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1520536029}
review:
Minor problems:
*Because of the size of the arenas some times you need to zoom out. While you can zoom out, you CAN'T control your units during zoom out, so you have to constantly change to zoom out and zoom in which is uterly useless and broken function.
*The Hard AI is retarded at most I beat it on all maps under 2-5 minutes so you are unable to even practice with it but then again developing smart AI is hard for the unskilled programmers.

Major problems:
*When you play VS players on some maps there are freeze spells that can be cast at the moment your unit step on them (gain control). Those spells are AoE and because your units move as swarm they can easily get frozen resulting in your army been wiped, just because you was not the first to rush this spell. Because of the nature of this spell "INSTANT", because of balance issues on all games in the world there is COOLDOWN or CHANNELING TIME. This is because this is game changing ability so the other player can respond to this high threat. Because of the nature of this game maybe you sacrifice units in order to cast this spell and the effect is based on how many units you sacrificed since you risk nothing casting it and you gain only benefits.

Recommendations:
*I can see you created waypoints for the spawners which is good for automation purposes, but make the spawner size smaller and the units to be unable to go on top of it that that much so players can more clearly know what they are doing.
*While having spells is cool function adding channeling/recharge time is recommended. Other option is to make the effect based on how many units you sacrificed on the platform.

Conclusion:
*Because of the above problem I find this game to be unfit for play and I cannot recommend it until the above problem is fixed.
*If they don't put some interesting campaign in this game and increase the size of the arenas I can't recommend this game for above 5€ as at the momment it have less content than a tetris and the size is the same as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965982733', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1479908233}
review: Boid is an entertaining 1v1 RTS that isn't finished but priced for anyone to give it a try.  It's too early to expect balanced gameplay but what's there is solid.  The object of this game is to capture spawn points to build units for you, and then capture additional points that turn those basic units into specialized units: I.e. a slow tank unit, artillery, or speedy scouts.  Get it and buy a copy for a friend because the AI is a bit frustrating to play against.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960416131', 'num_games_owned': 1135, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1541474417}
review: This game is more complex than it looks folks. Since there are three different difficulty settings for bots, you can freely experiment with lots of strategies before jumping online. I've just started playing and from what I can see, Boid has potential. I'm not good enough to jump online yet, but I will soon to at least test the waters. I believe TinyBuild is creating a rather unique game. I'm eager to see how it updates over the next few months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046923578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1426398031}
review: Ideal for anyone interested in RTS, simple but it still offers a lot of depth in its gameplay, delivers perfectly on everything mentioned, there are diverse classes, variety of maps, and overall very satisfying gameplay. The ability to play against bots (with 3 different difficulty settings) makes things really easy to learn at your own pace. My biggest problem with this game is the fact that there aren't a lot of players on it frequently so you won't find a game right away but the numbers I hope will slowly rise with early access and the addition of new features. Can't wait for everything that's coming for the game, this is definitely recommended to anyone interested in the genre.

review: Гениальная Эуфлория встречает увлекательную Спору. Уже сейчас игра вызывает массу положительных эмоций и приятных впечатлений. Простота управления сочетается с множеством тактических ходов. ИИ даже на легком уровне способно потрепать нервы игроку. А для заядлых киберспортсменов реализован мультиплеер и проводятся постоянные правки баланса. С введением созданного сообществом контента и одиночной кампании игра будет просто шедевральной, однако и цена будет выше. Так что. рекомендуется к покупке всем ценителям жанра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119883529', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1431238882}
review:
Review update @ May 10, 2015

AI mode has been greatly improved. When I first bought this game, I only could pick specific maps to play with AI. It felt like I was fighting against enemy spawner rather than Artificial Intelligence. Now it's changed. You can choose any map including the ones you made, then AI will adapt to that map like other strategy game's AI do.

Yet there's some problems including crashing issue, but still looks so fine for me as a game in developement. I'll be waiting for the next update.

-------------------------------------------

When you start the game, you're given one testicle which continuously produces sperm cells. You move them into other egg cells to dominate them. Once dominated, it also makes sperms for you. More testicles means more sperms.

Once you reach enough amount of sperms, you finally march onto enemy egg cells to make them pregnant. Grab this game and make your baby!

+Pros
+Simple, noticeable graphic design.
+Various mutation choice and many mutation spots around the map, which requires both strategy and tactics.
+Short play time per a session.

-Cons
-There's no real egg cells to inject my REAL sperms.
-Game shuts off occasionally, hope developers fix it soon.

It's currently on early access but still very enjoyable. Can't wait for further update including map editor. 8/10

Early Access Review written on Jan 20, 2015
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561197998391180', 'num_games_owned': 3439, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1424922604}
review:
Most RTS games are extremely complex. Often you need to accomplish A and B before C can be completed. Boid takes an entirely new spin on an old favorite by simplifying it into something that is easily digestable, even if you only have a few minutes to sit down and play. The accessibility of Boid is certainly one of its strongest tenants. Basic units come from Spawn Pools, then they are put into a larger pool to turn them into the class of your choosing as identified by the symbols. The classes are quite varied, though most maps don't feature all the classes at once. Scouts are fast but lack defense, Crabs have massive attack but low speed. There are healers, poison-support units, and even kamikaze bombers! Figuring out how you prefer to coordinate them is great fun, and there is really no wrong answer which leads to a world of replayability. Once you have a sizeable force, you can set them up as a barricade to repel enemy intruders. The troops will need to be reinforced after each skirmish, which kept me delightfully rushing about the pool upgrading units and trying to keep my army of microorganisms bolstered enough to repel any danger. Some classes do counter each other, which means you'll probably want a mixed regiment of units to protect each of your spawn pools. If all you have is Crabs and Basics and an enemy Bomb shows up, they'll all be blown to smithereens... One shot with a ranged Gun unit could've saved them if only I had the foresight. This class-based RTS is simple, fast-paced, brutal, and I love it. Let's take an even deeper look at Boid.

One of the first things I feel I should mention is the online multiplayer. Currently there is only a 1v1 mode, but any game that is released with the capability for some raw PvP gives me a warm fuzzy feeling. Bots send tiny regiments of units to scout your defenses, however most player fights end up as a giant war of attrition. While bot battles are usually short and succinct, PvP battles can rage on for upwards of thirty minutes. The center of the battlefield becomes a killing field, wave after wave of units, some too young to even have a class, sent to die for your glory. It reminds me a lot of trench warfare, both players sacrificing everything they have in order to gain just a few more feet of leverage. Then, just when you think you've pushed them into hiding, a regiment of scouts executes a flanking attack that decimates your forward force. The action is extremely tense, which impresses me to no end mostly because of the simplicity of the graphics. Everything is portrayed in minimal detail, but at the same time, nothing feels left out. At no point did I feel confused about if a unit was functioning, from the Bomb's rippling explosion to the Medic's healing wave, everything feels wonderfully pieced together. Currently the map selection is minimal, but Steam Workshop support will soon be added, allowing you to create your very own microscopic battleground.

Unfortunately, the game doesn't have any background music during the actual battle. The music that is offered during the selection menu is quite fitting though, and when ordered to move the different classes will utter unique cries of confirmation. You start to feel connected to your microscopic minions. Proud of their victories, though when they are defeated it is only due to your tactics. Strategies must be shifted based on the layout of the map, and the spawn/class pools. The game never felt over my head, and even features a brief tutorial. I'm extremely impressed at how easy it is to isolate a class, or break off a regiment from your main force. There are red pulses on the edge of your screen which let you know if you're being attacked, and in which direction. If one you capture a pool, or get one of yours taken the entire screen will flash. There are very important minor details that make the game feel much more alive, especially when facing a top level player. A squad of Scouts can be sent to distract at one spawning pools, while the bulk of your fighting forces takes another. I desperately want to see four-player maps with every unit available. Currently the price sits at $3, which is unbelievable for what is offered. The price will increase when workshop support is added, and again when single-player campaigns are finally offered. My suggestion would be to jump on this bandwagon as soon as possible. Boid offers a swarm of fun and can only get better. I'm positive that with Workshop support, this microscopic game could blow up bigger than it ever dreamed.

There is little to say negatively about Boid. It does feel a bit bare bones, but for a recently released Early-Access title it is extremely playable. The player-base is currently quite tiny so you might be waiting for a while to hop into any PvP battles, but hopefully that will be remedied in-part with this review. I feel that the class UI could be cleaned up slightly with the addition of hotkeys, since the cursor really does need to be everywhere at once in this sort of action-RTS. Right now the game can become anything, and while hope springs eternal, reality is usually a lot less kind. I hope to see different modes implemented aside from direct obliteration of your opponent. Perhaps a hard-point or capture-the-flag gamemode? Then there are the aforementioned bigger maps... Boid looks to me like to will be able to deliver. Much care obviously went into its creation. As proven by the variety of options to select from, including something called "Colorblind Mode", basically changing all the green/red in the game to blue/yellow... An interesting concept, but one I didn't end up applying, even as a colorblind person. Still the gameplay is blazing fast fun, and one would be crazy to complain about MORE options. Thanks to tinyBuild and Mokus for a fantastic game that will keep me coming back for a long time to come.

Summary: Aquatic RTS with a lovely minimalist design, and plenty of potential.
Final Score: 7/10 for aesthetic, replayability, and tiered goals/pricing.

Check out the full text/photos: http://www.indiegamebundles.com/review-boid-early-access/
Video Review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nf4dK80XA1Q

author: {'steamid': '76561198002539613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1421527680}
review:
This game is a lot familiar to the mobile game: Galcon the only difference is that there some different units to use. There are minion spawners, you capture them to generate more minions and you can upgrade standart minions using the different unit upgrade points.

This game is fun if you liked Galcon and that type of micro strategy games you will like this one. The only let down for me so far was: There is no 3,4,5... multiplayer support and I am not sure if it is coming or not. All you can do is a 1v1 match as far as multiplayer is concerned. AI(Single player) is not so bad, hard difficulty provides some challenge but if you are familiar with the genre; it is really trivial to beat them.

Graphics are nice and Sounds are better. Game UI and menus are a bit dull, but hey! It can be improved. Units are balanced and game itself allows players to micro manage units. You can't put hotkeys to units( like AOE(M), Starcraft etc... CTRL + number ) or I could not manage it anyway, that was another let down for me. 

All in all, I recommend this game. It is really worth the price. Single player is a bit boring after you figure out units and stuff but multiplayer is hella fun.  We need more players for multi so, buy this game!!

review:
Boid:

author: {'steamid': '76561198056255669', 'num_games_owned': 1912, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1582457365}
review:
I must say, this game is quite engaging. It is still early access while i write this.
I will give it 7/10.

[b] Pros: [/b]
1. Gameplay is challenging and fun. (After playing the same map with bots for sometime, you do find a routine to beat the AI. Some improvements to the AI will help the game. At present it can get a little predictable.)
2. Variety of game modes and maps.
3. Variety of Units present to pose a different challenge in each mode.
4. Can be quite competitive with a skiled opponent.

[b] Cons: [/b]
1. Very few people available for online matches. Last i played, it showed:
    Total players: 15
     Players looking for opponent: 1 (I take it this was me :P)
     But i did find some opponents at various times of the day. Hopefully this will change soon.
2. The user interface could do with some more work. Like the ability to group units together with hot keys, Showing the unit stats on hovering over them on the side panel, a smaller side panel. A wider screen view would also definitely help. Right now there is only one zoom level - the completely zoomed out view where you have a look at the entire map and the default playing view. It would really help people have their own custom zoom levels with which they are comfortable with. One which can be scroll zoomed in or out.
3. The in-game music is fine, but doesn't make me want to keep playing. Some better music would really help the game's acceptability to the masses.
4. The mouse controls feel a bit sluggish. Maybe its because I prefer accurate mouse aims in fps games.


There can be some improvements that can and probably will be made considering its Early Access. But overall the game is definitely worth a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002734128', 'num_games_owned': 3358, 'num_reviews': 928, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1468029812}
review:
First Impressions:

Boid is an RTS similar to that of Eufloria, Oil Rush, and Planets Under Attack. Unlike Eufloria, certain bases are dedicated to spawning units while others are not. Instead, other bases allow you to convert units from "basic" to something else with each unit class having its own strengths, weaknesses, and stats. It's a very tactical game and the AI is incredibly challenging, even on the "easy" difficulty setting. A map editor will be introduced down the line which I'll be interested to try out. I would have liked the ability to be able to set the number of AI opponents...at present, it seems like maps only support a total of two players. It would be fun to see what a three or four player game would look like, I think. $3 is a good value for what the game currently offers.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yhjE4_8KFjQ

author: {'steamid': '76561198017563282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1428764798}
review:
EARLY ACCESS 16/12/2014
REVIEWED WITH A PRESS KEY

Boid is an awesome unique RTS game that is very simple to play but requires a lot of thought as different units have different strengths and weaknesses and isn't made entirely obvious from the get go which means you may wanna practice before going up against others as they may have better stratagies than you.

---Gameplay---
It's like most RTS game, you select your units and decide where you want them to go, the game features control points that have their own unique abilities attached to them such as turning your normal minions into fierce crabs or activating a spawner zones to make more minions. Strategies are key to this game as without them the opposition will have the advantage. Combining fast moving weak minions with slow but strong crabs is more effective than just crabs as they will just get annihalated. After a while of gameplay the game will speed up making you act more efficiently.

---Conclusion---
This game is definately for RTS fans and even casual gamers. I give the game a 9/10 for being fun, unique and a true gem of a game!

---YouTube Video---
A few games with my friend which shows that tactics really do matter https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q_4m652KCnA

author: {'steamid': '76561198139354770', 'num_games_owned': 1237, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1428595510}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971194874', 'num_games_owned': 4903, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1427890479}
review:
Review basiert größtenteils auf ein paar Partien im Betatest.

Nett aber kein SC...

Boid ist ein vereinfachtes RTS Spiel, gerade die Reduktion auf das Einheitenmanagement ist meiner Ansicht nach sowohl Stärke als auch Schwäche des Spiels. 
Stärke, da man überlegen muss in welchen Einheiten man seine morphen möchte, Schwäche, da mir persönlich Elemente wie Baureihenfolge (1) und Gebäudeplatzierungen fehlen.
(1) Eine Baureihenfolge existier insofern, dass man entscheiden muss in welcher Reihenfolge man die vorhandenen "Produktionsstätten" einnimmt.

Die Kaufempfehlung ist ausschließlich für Leute, denen die Spielbeschreibung und insb. die Gameplayvideos zusagen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059095828', 'num_games_owned': 3334, 'num_reviews': 337, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1516776140}
review: I played a game like this once, it had no MP, the ai was terrible, and it was very easy to outsmart the AI making the game too easy. With this game, even to beat the AI on easy was a struggle. Unlike games in the past like this that focused on trying to overpower the AI, in this game you have to trick the enemy. Hide the majority of your force from its sight, and when it tries to attack you, repel the attack and take over the location it deserted to attack you. This is a game of risks, you do not know how many enemy lay waiting for you on their stronghold. And always remember to convert your forces to types that can do more damage from the basic spawners. Try to even out the types of your forces, all guns and you will die at close range, but having a few guns when charging an enemy stronghold can help snipe a few before you reach there. Its all tactics, and now, you can see if you can outsmart your friends in MP!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028665187', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1419880320}
review:
Having played a bit of boid before the early access (Private tester), i can say that this is RTS in it's simplest form without any comprimise.

There are lots of RTS games and they are quite difficult to get into because you have to learn the classes, maps, strats etc etc.

While you get this in BOID (It is an RTS after all), it makes it very simple. The art style is quite simple but looks gorgeous. 

Now on to the game itself.

There are two team (Red and Green) and there are currently 8 different classes and they all look very different (Making them easy to differentiate) and there are many variety of maps.

You both get a side of the map and start with spawners. You then have to take over class spawners (Each map has different kinds of spawners). Then eventually you have to take over the other players spawners. Once you take over their spawners, it's GG.

Another very good thing about the game is that the matches are short and quite intense (Which is very good in my opinion).

I haven't played much because not many people had the game (<20) and i've only found 2 people in online matches.
But this was before the early access.
NOw it's in early access, i will be playing this more often and after the addition of steam workshop, it'll be a very good game!

Costing less than £2 (08/01/2014), i don't see how you can go wrong with this game

Recommended :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198075990419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1421066431}
review:
Today is the day Boid is entering Early Access.
I normally don't play games in Early Access. Never.
But Boid is an exception. This game doesn't feel like an Early Access game. 

I first had the chance to play Boid at Gamescom 2014 in Cologne and totally loved it. After completing tinybuild's card collection game I received a beta invitation for Boid and since then I'm playing the game and enjoying it. 
It's a very entertaining RTS which is a lot of fun at current state. Even though the game is a little bit short on content the current price is more than fair. The fact that this game is still in Early Access should tell you that more content is on it's way and the price will increase in the future! At the moment the game is incredibly low priced for what it already provides on content so even if you're only interested in a game you can play every once in a while take a shot and try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055409429', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1468015599}
review:
I got into the Beta and got the game for free! Here's a review for you lovely people:

[u][b]Pros:[/b][/u]
• The strategy is great - this game being made for strategy - there are lots of different types of cellular creatures to play with. Perhaps there should be more to do than just capturing circles though.
• Interesting music style: it's bouncy and has a sort of tribal feel.
• The graphics are not intensive at all and should run fairly well on old computers.

[u][b]Cons:[/b][/u]
• There's not much of a player base (this game is just off-the-shelf!), but that will hopefully be improved as time goes on.
• The amount of clicking you need to do needs to be dimmed down a lot, it's impossible to concentrate on fifty things happening all at once.
• The general user interface needs work; it feels a bit bulky as it is right now.

I'm looking forward to Workshop Support and >2 player games. :)

Overall it's good so far, get it while it's cheap!
